Sentencas: Two gold-base active metal brazes (gold-ABA and gold-ABA-V) were evaluated for oxidation resistance to 850 degrees C, and used to join yttria-stabilized zirconia (YSZ) to a corrosion-resistant ferritic stainless steel for possible use in solid oxide fuel cells.
Titulo: Brazing of stainless steel to yttria-stabilized zirconia using gold-based brazes for solid oxide fuel cell applications

Sentencas: Thermogravimetric analysis and optical microscopy and scanning electron microscopy coupled with energy-dispersive spectroscopy were used to evaluate the braze oxidation behavior, and microstructure and composition of the YSZ/braze/steel joints.
Titulo: Brazing of stainless steel to yttria-stabilized zirconia using gold-based brazes for solid oxide fuel cell applications

Sentencas: Both gold-ABA and gold-ABA-V exhibited nearly linear oxidation kinetics at 850 degrees C, with gold-ABA-V showing faster oxidation than gold-ABA.
Titulo: Brazing of stainless steel to yttria-stabilized zirconia using gold-based brazes for solid oxide fuel cell applications

Sentencas: Both brazes produced metallurgically sound YSZ/steel joints due to chemical interactions of Ti and V with the YSZ and steel substrates.
Titulo: Brazing of stainless steel to yttria-stabilized zirconia using gold-based brazes for solid oxide fuel cell applications
